en_title: SJ begins visit in Beijing (with photos)
zh_title: 律政司司長在北京展開訪問行程（附圖）

en: The Secretary for Justice, Mr Rimsky Yuen, SC, today (June 27) made courtesy calls on the President of the Supreme People's Court, Mr Zhou Qiang; the Procurator-General of the Supreme People's Procuratorate, Mr Cao Jianming; and the Vice Minister of Public Security, Mr Chen Zhimin, to exchange views on matters of mutual interests including the legal and judicial co-operation between the Mainland and Hong Kong.

Mr Yuen briefed Mr Zhou on one of the major policies of the Department of Justice (DoJ), namely to enhance Hong Kong's status as the legal and dispute resolution services centre in the Asia Pacific region. They also exchanged views on the mutual legal assistance in civil and commercial matters between the Mainland and Hong Kong.

During the meeting with Mr Cao, Mr Yuen gave an update on the latest developments of the DoJ's prosecution work. Mr Yuen said that Hong Kong had been co-operating closely with the Mainland and other jurisdictions to combat cross-border crimes.
Mr Yuen briefed Mr Chen on the DoJ's work, and exchanged views on the criminal judicial co-operation between the Mainland and Hong Kong.

Mr Yuen will attend the opening ceremony of the Asia Pacific Regional Arbitration Group Conference 2013 tomorrow (June 28), and will deliver a speech on the future development of arbitration and the latest situation of the arbitration services in Hong Kong.
zh: 律政司司長袁國強資深大律師今日（六月二十七日）在北京先後拜訪了最高人民法院院長周強、最高人民檢察院檢察長曹建明及公安部副部長陳智敏，就包括內地及香港的法律及司法合作等雙方關心的事項交換意見。
袁國強向周強介紹律政司其中一項主要政策，即提升香港作為亞太地區法律和解決爭議服務中心的地位。他們並就內地與香港的民商事司法互助事宜交換意見。
在與曹建明的會面中，袁國強向他介紹律政司刑事檢控工作的最新情況。袁國強表示，香港與內地及其他司法管轄區一直保持緊密合作，打擊跨境罪行。
袁國強向陳智敏介紹了律政司的工作，雙方並就內地與香港的刑事司法合作交換意見。
袁國強明日（六月二十八日）將出席「2013年亞太區域仲裁組織大會」的開幕禮，並於會上就仲裁的未來發展及香港仲裁服務的新近情況發表演說。

They also exchanged views on the mutual legal assistance in civil and commercial matters between the Mainland and Hong Kong.
During the meeting with Mr Cao, Mr Yuen gave an update on the latest developments of the DoJ's prosecution work
Mr Yuen said that Hong Kong had been co-operating closely with the Mainland and other jurisdictions to combat cross-border crimes.
Mr Yuen briefed Mr Chen on the DoJ's work, and exchanged views on the criminal judicial co-operation between the Mainland and Hong Kong.

Mr Yuen will attend the opening ceremony of the Asia Pacific Regional Arbitration Group Conference 2013 tomorrow (June 28), and will deliver a speech on the future development of arbitration and the latest situation of the arbitration services in Hong Kong.
